title: Event policy
text: We consider any gathering of people, at our request, an event.

title: Event policy
text:
Rules

We will be running all our events virtually by default.
Local in-person events are permitted when a clear added value is documented.
Everywhere we can go in 8 hours with public transport is considered local.
In-person events only happen with the consent of attendees.
Hybrid events are organized as virtual first.
The event policy applies to both internal and external events







Note



For more detailed explanations, see our latest blog on our Event policy

title: Introduction
text:
Introduction
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.





References

Knuth, Donald E. 1984. ‚ÄúLiterate Programming.‚Äù Comput. J. 27 (2): 97‚Äì111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: Using Discord
text:
Summary



Discord is where we gather our ResearchEquals community of practice. You can join the Discord server and take part in the (voice) chat, activities, and sharing that takes place there.

title: Using Discord
text:
What is Discord?
Discord is an asynchronous communication channel. It is very similar to Slack, if you are familiar.
Discord consists of many servers. Each server is a community of its own. The ResearchEquals server is separate from other servers.
In each server, there are channels. Most of these are text channels, where you can chat with others. There are also audio channels, where you can have conversation.

title: Using Discord
text:
Why Discord?
We primarily use Discord because it has‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶great audio connectivity (almost like you‚Äôre on the phone!)
‚Ä¶reduces Zoom fatigue (video off by default)
‚Ä¶allows us to invite many people without limitations (costs are not per user, but for added features)
‚Ä¶great moderation features

title: Using Discord
text:
Getting started

Create a Discord account
Join the ResearchEquals server
Read the house rules
Introduce yourself in #general
Go into an audio channel and see how it works

title: Using Discord
text:
Getting help
We‚Äôre a pretty friendly bunch in there. If you need any assistance, ask in #help. No matter whether it‚Äôs debugging your audio or how to create your own Discord server - somebody will help you out!
In the case of somebody being a pain, tag @mods and we will check it out. We do not tolerate any direct or indirect hate speech (see also our Code of Conduct).

title: Welcome to the Liberate Science handbook üìöü§©
text:
This is our collective handbook, where we collect the resources needed to create a shared understanding of how we work. Some of it is descriptive (how we actually work), some of it is prescriptive (how we should work).
This handbook applies to both employees, contractors, volunteers, and otherwise.
How we work is continuously evolving, so we encourage suggested edits! This also means reading up regularly to ensure you are aware of changes.

title: Welcome to the Liberate Science handbook üìöü§©
text:
Where to start?

Completely new? Go through the onboarding pages.
Need a refresher? Each page starts with a summary!
Need to find something specific? Use the full-text search in the top-right corner!
Want to explore? Look at the index to find all topics included.

title: Summary
text:
Summary
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.
